body_html:
@ry I used resize_nearest_neighbour to circumvent that problem: https://github.com/cesarsalgado/tensorflowed/blob/master/models/residual_nets.py#L46

Or you could also use average pooling for sub-sampling, although it will not be exactly what the paper proposes.
body_text:
@ry I used resize_nearest_neighbour to circumvent that problem: https://github.com/cesarsalgado/tensorflowed/blob/master/models/residual_nets.py#L46
Or you could also use average pooling for sub-sampling, although it will not be exactly what the paper proposes.
body:
@ry I used resize_nearest_neighbour to circumvent that problem: https://github.com/cesarsalgado/tensorflowed/blob/master/models/residual_nets.py#L46 

Or you could also use average pooling for sub-sampling, although it will not be exactly what the paper proposes.
